DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of dose conversion from hydrocodone/ acetaminophen (Vicodin®) to the buprenorphine transdermal system (Butrans™) in subjects with osteoarthritis pain of the hip or knee. The double-blind treatment intervention duration is 2 weeks during which time supplemental analgesic medication will be allowed.
DOC.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Dose Conversion From Vicodin® to Buprenorphine Transdermal System (Butrans™) in Subjects With OA Pain
DOC.detailed_description: Buprenorphine is a synthetic opioid analgesic with over 25 years of international clinical experience indicating it to be safe and effective in a variety of therapeutic situations for the relief of moderate to severe pain.
DOC.criteria: osteoarthritis of the hip or knee taking a regularly scheduled regimen of hydrocodone/ acetaminophen for their osteoarthritis OA pain. currently have condition requiring a stable regimen of acetaminophen (APAP). a history of chronic conditions, other than OA of the hip or knee joints, requiring frequent, intermittent analgesic therapy. Other protocolspecific exclusion/inclusion criteria may apply.
